body:
A first attempt; builds successfully. Some dependencies have hard-coded
dependencies where they shouldn't (e.g., hdf5 -> mpi, libxml -> python),
but that's a different rabbit hole.

---

Attempts to build Qt in spack have proven difficult on Fedora 23. I think it should probably not require the whole of mesa, llvm, gtk+, and a whole host of other packages by default. Qt does work if you tell it to build the gui and have a Qt installed.
